t: Why*pn do the nations conspire and*ld the peoples plot in vain?
The*ln kings of the earth rise up and*ld the rulers band together against*ld the Lord*s and against his anointed, saying,
“Let*ln us break their chains and*ld throw off their shackles.”
The*pn One enthroned in heaven laughs; the*ld Lord scoffs at them.
He*ln rebukes them in his anger and*ld terrifies them in his wrath, saying,
“I*ln have installed my king on*ld Zion, my holy mountain.”
I*p will proclaim the Lord’s*s decree: He*pn said to me, “You are my son; today*ld I have become your father.
Ask*ln me, and*ld I will make the nations your inheritance, the*ld ends of the earth your possession.
You*ln will break them with a rod of iron; you*ld will dash them to pieces like pottery.”
Therefore,*pn you kings, be wise; be*ld warned, you rulers of the earth.
Serve*ln the Lord*s with fear and*ld celebrate his rule with trembling.
Kiss*ln his son, or he will be angry and*ld your way will lead to your destruction, for*ln his wrath can flare up in a moment. Blessed*ld are all who take refuge in him.
